page.title: 18BIOGRAPHY
page.content: In the ancient churchyard of Kilmuir on the north shore of the Firth are many graves of Patersons,all seafaring men.Some died or were drowned abroad as long ago as the 18th century.Mr.Jim Paterson lives at Tigh na Mara in North Kessock.He was a harbour pilot in the Firth of Inverness,like his father and grandfather.The pilots lived in Craigton on the lower slope of Ord Hill where they could see the Firth from Ardersier and into the harbour.Mr Paterson's two sons go to sea. Once a Paterson,an old pilot,met a mermaid on the shore.He took her home. While she lived there all would go well and the family would be safe.But after a while she escaped back to sea and took her spell with her.Mr. Paterson is retired now.He keeps a good garden.
